rows.name: Education, Scientific and Pedagogical Qualification
cells: Final year student, BS, MS, or Specialist Degree in mathematical specialty.
MS or Specialist Degree in mathematical specialty.
MS or Specialist Degree in mathematical specialty.
MS or Specialist Degree in mathematical specialty. Preferably Ph.D. Preferably experience in teaching mathematics (applied mathematics) in the university

MS or Specialist Degree in mathematical specialty, Ph.D. or Doctor of Science. Experience in teaching mathematics (applied mathematics) in the university, academic title of associate professor or professor.

rows.name: Professional Experience
cells: Entry-level position - not expected to have previous work experience.
At least 1 year of relevant experience.
At least 3 years of relevant experience.
An experienced professional with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role.
A professional with a minimum of 7 years’ experience.

rows.name: Professional Skills
cells: Solve formalized and strictly stated problems in the area of applied mathematics using known methods.
Use literature analysis and numeric experiments, select the most suitable known method for solving formalized problems in applied mathematics.
Upgrade known methods to elaborate the best approach to solving a given applied mathematical problem.
Develop new methods for solving given applied mathematical problems.
Propose a new substantial and appropriate formalization for a given applied problem and develop a method for solving the problem.

rows.name: Software Development Skills
cells: Basic software development skills.
Ability to develop a software application that implements a found solution for the applied mathematical problem.
Ability to develop a software application that implements a found solution for the applied mathematical problem.
Ability to develop a software application that analyzes characteristics for approaches to the solution for the applied mathematical problem.
Ability to develop a software application that analyzes characteristics for approaches to the solution for the applied mathematical problem.

rows.name: Data Analysis Skills
cells: Basic data analysis skills, working knowledge of main statistical methods and some statistical analysis software (e.g. SAS, SPSS, MATLAB, R)
Confident data analysis skills, working knowledge of main statistical methods and some statistical analysis software (e.g. SAS, SPSS, MATLAB, R)
Professional data analysis skills, working knowledge of main statistical methods and main statistical analysis software (e.g. SAS, SPSS, MATLAB, R)
Professional data analysis skills, perfect knowledge of main statistical methods and main statistical analysis software (e.g. SAS, SPSS, MATLAB, R)
Professional data analysis skills, perfect knowledge of statistical methods, experience in developing new approaches to data analysis.

rows.name: Design and Documentation Skills
cells: Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation
Able to create required documentation
Able to create high-quality project documentation
Able to create high-quality project documentation and analytical documents
Able to create high-quality project documentation and analytical documents

rows.name: Job Title
cells: Junior Algorithm Developer
Algorithm Developer
Senior Algorithm Developer
Lead Algorithm Developer
Principal Algorithm Developer

rows.name: Roles played/Specialization
cells: Plays the Algorithm Developer role
Plays the Algorithm Developer role
Plays the Algorithm Developer or Key Algorithm Developer role
Plays the Algorithm Developer or Key Algorithm Developer role.
Plays the Algorithm Developer or Key Algorithm Developer role.

rows.name: Responsibility and Reliability
cells: Expected to work effectively under supervision.
Expected to work without direct supervision.
Expected to be self-managing, work without supervision and check his/her own work thoroughly.

Expected to be self-managing, take full responsibility for a concrete problem or a whole project, work without supervision and check his/her own work thoroughly.

Can manage groups of 2-3 employees working on the same problem.

Expected to be self-managing, take full responsibility for a concrete problem, whole project or a set of projects, work without supervision and check his/her own work thoroughly.

 Can manage several groups of 2-3 employees working on different problems.

rows.name: Quality
cells: No specific expectations regarding quality.
Must show a sense of responsibility for the quality of the solutions created by him/her
Creates solutions in good quality
Must be a role model for colleagues; creates solutions in high quality.
Must be a role model for colleagues, on a par with the best industry standards; creates solutions in excellent-quality.
